mads.note: Cannot identify with Sergius of Resaina, d. 536. New Cath. encyc., c1967, says that Sergius of Resaina was probably the same as Sergius the Grammarian, but Encyc. brit., c1983, gives two separate articles for Sergius and Sergius of Resaina

Torrance, I.R. Christology after Chalcedon, 1988: t.p. (Sergius the Monophysite) p. 1, etc. (Sergius the Grammarian most common appellation; wrote Greek letters to Severus of Antioch, 515-517; nothing else known of his life or writings; not equated with Sergius of Resaina)
Encyc. brit., 15th ed., c1983: Micropaedia, v. 9, p. 68 (Sergius; Roman physician and priest, 5th-6th cent.)
